titleStmt.title: A discourse concerning God's judgements resolving many weighty questions and cases relating to them. Preached (for the substance of it) at Old Swinford in Worcester-shire: and now publish'd to accompany the annexed narrative, concerning the man whose hands and legs lately rotted off: in the neighbouring parish of Kings-Swinford, in Staffordshire; penned by another author. / by Simon Ford ...
titleStmt.author: Ford, Simon, 1619?-1699.
Illingworth, James, d. 1693. A just narrative or account of the man whose hands and legs rotted off.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by A.C. for Henry Brome, at the Gun at the West-end of St. Pauls,

notesStmt.note: "A just narrative or account of the man whose hands and legs rotted off" has special t.p.
Reproduction of original in the University of Illinois (Urbana-Champaign Campus). Library and Bodleian Library.

place.placeName: the Gun at the West-end of St. Pauls
